page.title: 03CHEW VALLEY LAKE BIRDS
page.content: The area is an ornithological centre important for ringing and studying bird migration.Over 4000 birds are ringed annually. Many species of wild fowl visit or over winter on the lake. Several areas including Denny Island are preserved as natural habitats for warblers, swans,geese and ducks.There are hides at Wick Green, Moreton Bank and Nunnery Point,all of which are extensively used by ornithologists.One hide was sponsored by Slimbridge Wild Fowl Trust.Permits to use hides can be obtained from Woodford Lodge.100000 or more young trees have been planted in the landscaping of the area and are reaching maturity to give cover to the birds and outstanding beauty to the area.Two picnic areas with fine views are open to the public with toilets and a shop.
